html:
After fulfilling my civilian service, I started studying software engineering at the [Hasso Plattner Institute](https://www.hpi.de/) in Potsdam.

During my studies, I gained practical experience and research skills. I specialized in Internet technologies and human-machine interfaces.

In 2011, I received my bachelor's degree with a final grade of 1.3.
title: Bachelor's Degree Program

html:
In my bachelor's thesis Development Process with the Orca Web Framework, I presented and evaluated the development process with [Orca](http://hpi.de/hirschfeld/projects/orca/index.html), a research web framework developed by a group of fellow students and me.

Orca enables single-language high-level web application development in Smalltalk by automatically translating client-side functionality to JavaScript and providing transparent bidirectional message passing for client-server communication.
title: Bachelor's Thesis

html:
With the objective to attain a master's degree, I continued my studies at the [Hasso Plattner Institute](https://www.hpi.de/).

I specialized in Internet technologies, operating systems, and information systems. Along the way, I gained insights into in-memory databases, embedded systems, parallel programming, metaprogramming, and e-learning, among other things.

In 2015, I happily received my master's degree with a final grade of 1.0.
title: Master's Degree Program

html:
As the final step of my studies, I wrote my master's thesis [A Versatile Platform for Practical Programming Exercises in Massive Open Online Courses](https://github.com/hklement/masters-thesis/blob/master/A%20Versatile%20Platform%20for%20Practical%20Programming%20Exercises%20in%20Massive%20Open%20Online%20Courses.pdf?raw=true), which addresses the question how to teach programming by means of massive open online courses, such as provided by [edX](https://www.edx.org/), [openHPI](https://open.hpi.de/), and [openSAP](https://open.sap.com/).

In this context, I built [Code Ocean](https://github.com/openHPI/codeocean), a web-based platform for practical programming exercises, designed to meet the demands of novice programmers and to satisfy the inherent scalability requirements of large-scale e-learning environments.
title: Master's Thesis
